intro: Neonauclea obversifolia, commonly known as the reverse-leaved naiad, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often glossy and dark green in color. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Neonauclea obversifolia is often found in wetland or aquatic environments, where it thrives in moist, shaded conditions.
